transfer_quarantine: In some prisons, but not all prisons
policy_details: In April 2023, Brazil set up the Interministerial Committee for the Elimination of Tuberculosis and Other Socially Determined Diseases (CIEDDS), considering the importance of a multisectoral approach, with more integrated and cross-cutting action between public policies. Among the most vulnerable populations addressed by the CIEDDS, the incarcerated population is included as a priority, in which specific actions are being established, for example: promoting data collection on people deprived of their liberty, in order to draw up a joint georeferencing and visualize the needs of these groups, as well as better coordinating health actions, among others.

activeTB_initialdx_details: 2022 the increase of new TB cases increased twice from 2021 with X-ray intervention.

barriers_guidelines_details: There is good collaboration between MoH and Prison authority
Support to twice yearly screening campaigns with digital x-ray has been added to the guideace
activeTB_initialdx_details: The country uses Gene xpert for all TB presumptive patiens
barriers_TBdx_details: Services for prison are mainstreamed into the programme, so they face similar challenges as programme e.g. stock outs of cartridges, Human Resources  shortages etc
policy_details: guidelines and SOPs are available for prisons and refresher trainings held annually to health workers and prison attendants

activeTB_screening_details: Pre-entry screening is conducted only in 2 Central Jails (Yangon & Mandalay). Not sure for other prisons. NTP mobile teams frequently visited to prisons and worksites in coordination with Prison Department and do systematic screening to all detainees. That would be occurred almost per prisons per year.
activeTB_initialdx_details: If there is abnormality in CXR and also prisoners with suggestive of TB signs and symptoms are undergo initial diagnosis of active TB by means of sputum microscopy and GeneXpert.
activeTB_confirmdx_details: As Myanmar is High TB burden country, confirmatory diagnosis of active TB is not usual.
treatment_details: It is in line with the NTP guidelines. National Prison Health policy is already developed, TB care & treatment is one of the components in this policy.
policy_details: It is in line with the NTP guidelines. National Prison Health policy is already developed, TB care & treatment is one of the components in this policy.

barriers_TBdx_details: Assess to Security settings are always a challenge due to the level of insecurity in the country

policy_details: There is no structured TB Control in Prisons, Few pilot were done through TB reach , Svreening is not conducted at entry and suspected is refered to Hospital

guidelines_recode: mention as high-risk but not specific policies
treatment_details: Prison facilities are responsible for reporting case notification and treatment outcome to the NTP
policy_details: Collaboration with the prison ministry is currently being done for prison TB management and policies

barriers_guidelines_othertext: The Agency in charge of prison system varies at different levels. There are prisons under the respective Local Government Units where the facility is located, the next level prisons are under the Dept of Interior and Local Government and the regional penal farms/colonies and the national institution are under the Dept of Justice.
barriers_guidelines_details: There is overcrowding and thus, funding is inadequate to support the high population.
activeTB_screening_details: This is usually done if a schedule with local health providers has been made.
activeTB_initialdx_details: Specimens may be transported to local Government labs for GX diagnosis. Some higher level prisons have on-site testing capacity.
activeTB_confirmdx_details: GX is already applied but usually in the higher level of prisons (regional and national).
barriers_TBdx_details: Lab capacity is limited esp if there are inadequate supplies like cartridges.
transfer_quarantine: In some prisons, but not all prisons
treatment_details: DOT is still in place while incarcerated and thus, adherence to treatment is high.
policy_details: How to apply patient-centeredness amongst PDLs At entry, while inside, At exit, since security is a primary consideration for the health worker.

barriers_guidelines_details: Challenges with sample transportation for planned routine screening of inmates and staff

TB_treatment_othertext: MDRTB positive cases are referred to a DRTB treatment site for admission and care

TB_treatment_othertext: there are treatment supporters(peerleaders/cough monitors)who also support in DOTs among detainees.
outcome_reporting_othertext: the initiating prison site reports on final treatment outcome but challenge some detain give wrong phone address despite being counselled on TB treatment adherence

policy_details: We have a dashboard that tracks some key indicators every month in the prisons with regard to TB and HIV

guidelines_other: The National TB Guidelines highlight incarcerated population as a key and vulnerable population that needs prioritization for TB management. They also provide specific policies and strategies for managing TB in prisons.
barriers_guidelines_othertext: Inadequate TB diagnostic tool.   Zambia has 106 prisons with about 26,000 prison population. Of these, 28 (26%) have a health clinic, one in Lusaka has a digital X-ray, & 7 have a GeneXpert machine.
activeTB_screening_throughout_othertext: A digital mobile truck installed with a digital ray is used during the mass screening.
activeTB_screening_details: In prisons without a TB diagnostic tool,  confirmation of TB is delayed due to security concerns because the sample or a prisoner has to be transported to a public health facility. When we conduct mass TB screening in prions, a mobile truck with a chest x-ray machine is brought on site.
initialdx_entry_othertext: Where available chest-x-ray,  in eligible patients, Urine LAM and also when a nearby public health facility has a TB LAMP, is used

When we conduct mass TB screening in prions, a mobile truck with a chest x-ray machine is brought on site.
barriers_TBdx_details: Inadequate health care workers and, where available, are not well trained on TB screening, diagnosis and treatment.
transfer_quarantine: In some prisons, but not all prisons
post_release_tx_othertext: However, some prisoners do not go back to where they have been referred to especially  this is where they committed a crime. There is lack of capacity to systematically check that the prisoner has reached the facility he/she was referred to
treatment_details: Providing TB Preventive treatment (TPT) remains a challenge considering that in the prison setting, there is an ongoing transmission of TB  because of overcrowding. The dilemma is should once off TPT sufficient?
policy_details: Implementation of TB in prions policies are hampered by lack of direct funding to TB in prisons activities. The issue of nutrition which is risk factor for TB is achellenge because the TB program can fund nutortion support
